messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Laurie unsub
messages.msgSnippet: Maybe I have missed a few posts or maybe I just take things a different way. I am sorry you feel picked on or put down, but honestly, if you don t want to be
messages.messageBody:
Maybe I have missed a few posts or maybe I just take things a different way.
I am sorry you feel picked on or put down, but honestly, if you don't want
to be here then dont be here. I know you said you un-subbed, which maybe if
you stay a little longer you could get something more than you have, maybe
not just a thought. Also, just delete all from this list if all its doing is
making you so angry. Which ever you choose I do wish you the best of luck in
all your ventures!
Indiana Tami

"You must be the change you wish to see in the world"
~Ghandi

Try out this fun site!
http://www.neopets.com/refer.phtml?username=angel1bunny




>From: "M and L Hand" <mandlhand@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Christians?????
>Date: Sat, 8 Sep 2001 15:59:55 +1000
>
>You must be kidding, Indiana Tami. That is all that has been going on here
>for the last week! Go back and read again. Everything from "you are lying
>to your kids by doing that" to "you aren't really unschooling if you do
>that" to "if you require them to do anything, you aren't trusting them, and
>trust is the most important thing" to "why is reading more important than
>TV?".
>
>I'm sure Bridget can provide more examples - she's been put down as much as
>I have.
>Laurie
>
>
>[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
